Question:
1. You're defining a custom type. Why would you use a struct instead of a class? 
Enter the three best answers below.

Options.0: Because the type is very large (it has many fields) and you expect to have many instances
Options.1: Because the type needs to support multiple interfaces.
Options.2: Because the type is very small and you expect to have many instances
Options.3: Because the type will never have a derived classes.
